Key Arguments: The importance of free speech in Australia, as long as it is polite and non-derogatory.
Disagreement among citizens is beneficial as it encourages investigation and becoming more informed.
Concerns about a non-elected body like ACMA having the power to decide what constitutes misinformation or disinformation.
Notable Quotes: We live in a country where ‘free speech’ (as long as it is presented in a polite and non-derogatory way) is the envy of many people the world over.
To have a Government Statutory Authority such as the ACMA (a non-elected body) to decide what is ‘misinformation or disinformation,’ is extremely dangerous.
